Reviews.Title: “Great location for PNE and Coliseum Concerts”
Reviews.Author: NottinghamBabe
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel in advance for overnight stay with 4 friends in to see Johnny Reid concert. 15 minutes walk to PNE. Found staff helpful and friendly. We had 3 king sized rooms fridge, microwave & modern big screen TV + free Wifi. We would have preferred 3 rooms next to each other since we did book well in advance. At least we were all on same 3rd floor. Complimentary wholesome and fresh breakfast service in hotel available- 6 - 10.a.m. Limited table space so plan ahead. Clean comfy beds. Not a lot of restaurants close by but easy to get to by taxi 5 - 10 min ride away. We ate at the PNE after our walk. Free parking and easy access to No 1 Canada freeway and or North Vancouver via Ironworkers Bridge. Easy bus access - Wd stay again if going to PNE location for concerts or PNE fair.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: daveobee
Reviews.Content: Easy access to the freeway, clean room, free wifi, free parking, free breakfast, spacious room, friendly staff, good bed, a couple of restaurants within walking distance. Price was a bargain. It can be tough to find a nice place at a good price in Vancouver, but this one certainly qualifies.

Reviews.Title: “good beds, clean, and good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Canada-Martin
Reviews.Content: It's all good here, we booked it because of additional parking needed for a mini utility trailer, and were pleasantly surprised by what got offered to us. It's a few minutes away from downtown, public transportation stops in front of hotel. Matresses were very good, had fridge, tv and coffeemaker, Rooms are clean and daily cleaned properly, towels changed, shower soap etc etc. Continental breakfast was included and is only a 2 steps away from being called hot buffet, even the coffee is good ( as european background it's important to us) Staff is extremely friendly and helpfull if needed. ( way to go Ali) I will recommend this hotel and stay here again when i need accomodation in Vancouver. M.K. from Sundre, Ab

Reviews.Title: “good value for family, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: TammyHap
Reviews.Content: My family of four, parents with 2 teenagers, recently stayed at this Ramada, chosen mostly for its location, within close walking distance to the PNE. I was happy to discover that the room I booked for us was quite spacious. The kids each had their own sleeping areas, one bed and a sofa pullout, and we had our bed in a seperate room. We had a microwave, and refrigerator and televisions at both sides, kids and ours. The room was clean and comfortable and the price was very reasonable compared to other hotels nearby. Free parking and a complimentary breakfast are offered. We had a quick bite but the room was a bit too small to accomodate many guests, this is something that should be addressed by the hotel management, but otherwise a comfortable hotel with a great amount of amenities for a really reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: ShaneSeattle
Reviews.Content: We returned to stay at the Hotel recently during a busy time after spending time there a few weeks earlier and were very happy with the level of service. The room was clean and well maintained, the breakfast pantry was always full even at the end of service late in the morning and the staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. We ended up staying longer than we expected and the staff were always happy to make sure we had everything we needed. The location of the Hotel was also a pleasant surprise, not far from the city and most major attractions and right near all the buses. We were with a car and the parking garage was easily accessible. I would highly recommend the Ramada at exhibition park and will return there whenever I am back in Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: patm1312
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and well maintained. A computer and printer was provided for guest use which proved very handy when we needed to check-in online and print boarding passes for an internal flight. Our room was comfortable without the frills (you get what you pay for). Breakfast was a continental breakfast but there was a good range of food. The only problem we found was that the breakfast room was very small and could not cope with the number of guests. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful and spent time pointing out the various areas of the city and even made some suggestions of places to visit. We found the hotel very handy for local transport as there is a bus stop right outside. Unless you are a McDonalds fan we didn't manage to find anywhere within the area to eat so we tended to stay out and eat wherever we were visiting for the day.

Reviews.Title: “nice place, ? location”
Reviews.Author: PaulGPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: we stayed here during the first weekend of August. The good points were we had a nice room; they upgraded us to a two room suite, which was very nice and comfortable. One room had a sofa and two chairs with the queen-size and the other room had a queen-size. The only strange thing was that they had two TVs, which my grandson liked, but the nicer TV was in the room without the sofa. I would encourage them to switch the furniture. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and quickly met our every request. The breakfast was excellent. I thought it was a very nice hotel. The downside was it was in a downtrodden neighborhood and a little far away from the center of the city. Half of the buildings in the area were boarded up, but we did find a nice deli which gave us free cookies and two free loaves of bread with our meal. Our room was on the street side so there was some noise, but it is a city. My only problem with this hotel is the location, but they do have free parking, a plus in Vancouver. Also, the hot tub was broken, and I got the idea it has been for a while.

Reviews.Title: “Won't go there again!”
Reviews.Author: Michael776
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through hotels.com. During my 6 day stay in this hotel, the towels were never replaced or washed. Dirt was swept under the bed. The receptionists were always nervous and upset as though something bad had happened. I asked them a couple of times for information about the city and transportation and every time I was responded in an impolite way. Some of them were very rude and impolite. Transportation was an issue as well. Won't recommend this hotel to any one.

Reviews.Title: “Will use this one every time”
Reviews.Author: fostermumMelfortSK
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the city to watch a football game at empire stadium. Hotel couldn't have been any closer! After the game we exited the gate, crossed the street on foot and were at the hotel. Perfect. Location is great for any visit. Playland's giant amusement park is a 5 minute walk away. Street location makes it easy to find downtown/harbour/chinatown etc. Area felt safe, parking was secure and plentiful. Our family suite was great. Breakfast had good variety of items to choose from. The only thing that topped all this is how friendly and helpful the front desk staff were. Felt like you were staying with family!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: smp147
Reviews.Content: The employees are very friendly and helpful. We could leave our luggage there before check in and after ckeck out. The rooms are clean and we had a fridge, an ironing board and a water boiler in our room. There a two automats with sweets and drinks. The breakfast was good but the breakfast room is too little for all the guests. Maybe you have to wait, to get your breakfast. To come to downtown, you have to take the bus.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff..Dirty room!”
Reviews.Author: madisonj7
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a concert that was happening at the PNE. The room itself was basic but did accommodate the 5 of us. The cleaniness of the room was very bad. There was no garbage bags in the cans, hair in the sink and on the floor and you could tell that the floors had not been vacuumed or washed properly. The building wasn't totally outdated but the hallways smelled musky and it would of been nice to have windows that opened to the outside! A basic continental breakfast was included, the front desk staff was pleasant, but nothing could make up for the poor quality cleaning of that room.

Reviews.Title: “Our favourite hotel on the mainland!”
Reviews.Author: laurierankin222
Reviews.Content: We just finished our 4th stay at the Ramada Vancouver (formerly Best Western) Exhibition Park. The staff is friendly and helpful, the management approachable, intelligent and open to suggestions. On this visit, our party included 2 adults and 2 teenage boys. Our accommodation was very spacious, with 2 rooms with a queen bed in each one, bathroom in between, small fridge, microwave, table, 2 comfy chairs and 2 televisions. The breakfast room has selections for a variety of eating styles, as our group included a celiac and a vegetarian. It was ideal for our two hungry young men! I noticed that the number of food choices has increased over the years. Since we were attending a Whitecaps game, the boys decided they wanted to make a sign. They said that the staff was supportive and enthusiastic about making this happen, putting together a large sign board and supplying them with a felt pen! As mentioned by other guests, the room is soundproof from the street outside and we enjoyed the quietness of our stay, even though it was "high season". While staying at the Ramada Vancouver Exhibition Park, we easily navigated our way to Surrey, downtown and to the Whitecaps Game, just steps away from the hotel! We enjoyed delicious meals just blocks away from the hotel, where restaurants are located, in both directions. Ramada Vancouver Exhibition Park is our choice when we want an affordable, pleasant hotel stay in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “OK motel for reasonable price in Vancouver in dodgy area”
Reviews.Author: Roadtoholidays
Reviews.Content: Rooms are old and require upgrading. Reception service was good. Motel is in a dodgy area without restaurants and far from city center. Low rate 81CAD per night for Vancouver, only if you're with car and on budget.

Reviews.Title: “Stellar price, reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: The_Viper16
Reviews.Content: Rooms are not very sound proof. Both noise above and hallway noise can be disruptive, but this is more the fault of inconsiderate guests. Hallways smell like smoke, but our room was fine. Staff is friendly, rooms and bathrooms are big, location is excellent and the price can't be beat for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: figgy77
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel.. the rooms are clean and big. nice flat screen tv. great customer service from the staff . in a great location easily accessible to buses close to playland/pne. will definatly stay there again

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected for less than I expected”
Reviews.Author: Highlander0
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an easy walk from the PNE/Playland park area. Upon getting to the hotel I was wary of how the front desk area looked - nice, but aged. However, it's obvious that they have done lots of renovations. Parking is included, which isn't always the case in Vancouver. The price was very reasonable - $~90 with tax for the night. The room was much better than I expected with clean carpeting, a beautiful big TV (37" HDTV), clean & crisp sheets, a comfy duvet, seats, a table and enough room for everything. The bathroom looked almost brand new. No complaints about the service or price, and the free breakfast was a LOT better than I've seen at other similar-priced hotels (see picture). The hallways, elevator and ice machine show the age of the place, but they were still running well and in good condition. My car was safe parked in the lot outside the front door as the desk was manned 24hrs. There were no odd smells or sounds and it all seemed very new. It's easy to forget that you're right next to two major highways because you simply can't hear the traffic. There's also a free computer and printer in the lobby, which is a nice perk. I'll be staying here again if I'm in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay and Great rate for Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Travelguy43
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 days and stayed in one of there larger rooms that has the two queen beds seperated by the batheroom that other reviewers have spoke of. One side is larger then the other and has a pullout bed. There is a small fridge, coffee maker, and microwave in the room. Our hotel room was on the street side but we were never bothered by street noise. This is a solid brick building and quite sound proof. The staff at the hotel was very friendly and we found the free breakfast to be good - we ate breakfast there evey morning - with 4 kids this was a deal for us. The hall ways have small floresent lights which makes the hallway dark and makes the hotel feel cheap. The hotel atmosphere would improve greatly with some brighter lights. The room was clean, beds were very comfortable, had a great sleep. The hotel was very quiet overall and we did not hear any other guests although there did not appear to be many people staying there at the time. There is a McDonalds accross the street and a great Sushi resturant up a couple of blocks and on the other side of the street...check it out. Although this hotel is on East Hastings Street it is a good area ....the East Hastings you have heard of is like 15 blocks to the west. We walked around at night and felt very safe. There is a major bus loop just up the block so you can get anywhere from there. in fact the Sky Train station is not that far away...a short bus ride. Like others have stated ...not a 5 star hotel but a great clean place to stay for the right prices.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: funf0rfamily
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, very freindly staff, nice break fast, clean rooms and good thing is not too far from down town specialy if you are not driving and traveling with your family

Reviews.Title: “This place STINKS, if you don't smoke, DON'T STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: SallyLorraine
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my teenage daughter to Vancouver for the Olympics and booked a room at this establishment. I called twice to confirm it was a non-smoking room. Young athletes really hate the smell of stale smoke, as do I. We arrived, the lobby smelled bad, we were taken to our room and it smelled like an OLD ASHTRAY. It was so disgusting my daughter burst into tears, DID WE REALLY HAVE TO STAY HERE? Fortunately, we were taken in by a local business owner who heard our situation while were eating lunch and never had to return. I think they ran out of non-smoking rooms and decided to change the stickers on the door. DO NOT TRUST BEST WESTERN!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Near the P&E as Advertised”
Reviews.Author: XCaliforniaGirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed nine days during the Olympics, a very busy time and the hotel staff was always friendly and knowledgable. Ali the GM gave me sightseeing tips as well as recommendations to local restaurants. The room had two separate sleeping areas with the bathroom in between which was an excellent way to design the space so I could sleep while my roommate worked on her computer at night. The maid staff was very tolerant of our unusual hours and also pleasant. The bus downtown was outside the front door and I took it all over Vancouver, never waiting but a few minutes. The figure skating venue was on the bus line but I preferred to walk to the P&E since it was so close.

Reviews.Title: “A place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: GDRODER
Reviews.Content: The parking lot was filled with garbage. I do not think it would be too hard to pick up and sweep once a day. The elevator was big and nice. The hotel had a strong new carpet smell. They should have vented it better. The fridge frooze our stuff. Had some troubles with internet access. Wish we had one of the updated rooms. Not too private on the back side, as people in the houses can see into your room.

Reviews.Title: “reasonable”
Reviews.Author: melagih
Reviews.Content: Positives: handy as the bus from in front of hotel goes directly to downtown (135), rooms decent but nothing special, perculator, reception staff helpfull. Negatives: room no ventilation, breakfast was below ave, a bit run down. OVERALL if u r staying in this area/pricerange obviously u dont expect 5star quality so, for the price...reasonable.

Reviews.Title: ““The suites in this hotel are unusually spacious but watch out for hidden fees.””
Reviews.Author: SCTravellers4
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised when we walked into a hotel room that was actually a suite! It had a living room and two queen-sized beds – each in a separate bedroom. Even though we didn’t take advantage of it, the kitchenette was also big and would allow anyone to create a great family meal. But there were a few drawbacks to this hotel. When we made the reservation for four, we were not told that there would be an extra fee for our adult son. Evidently, the price I was quoted over the phone for a one-night stay covered two adults only (me and my husband) because when we arrived, we were told that the hotel’s policy is to charge an extra $20 for each, additional adult. Also, although there is a covered carport, the stalls are very narrow and hard to maneuver – especially if you’re driving a van. Finally, even though the clerk was very friendly, he did not offer us any assistance (different room, coupon for extra night, etc.) or follow-up on our complaint that the toilet’s flushing capacity was extremely low. Is there a plumber in the house?

Reviews.Title: “Great location for attending the PNE”
Reviews.Author: miah2o
Reviews.Content: Checked out the review of this hotel and like with all hotel reviews there was good and bad ones. I would have to say I agree with those who rated the hotel highly (given it is a 3 star hotel). It was an excellent location to visit the PNE (2 blocks to the gate) and saved us $20 on parking fees at the fair. We stayed in a two queen rm which was so great with little kids as the beds are split up by the bathroom giving it a two room feel. Lots of space, mini fridge, microwave, 2 tvs. Beds were not the finest but not unsleepable & I am fussy with beds, I love my bed at home an nothing else compares. Free breakfast was included with varied choice: cereal, toast, eggs, muffins, danishes, apples, bananas, oranges, juice, coffee...couldn't really ask for much more. (yes the breakfast room is small but it wasn't that hard to deal with) For $182 CA (including taxes) you just can't go wrong with this hotel especially if your visiting the PNE.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kim_e2
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was very good. The neighbourhood isn't as bad as some may think. It's further down East Hastings, so there isn't any problems. When first coming into the hotel, it doesn't look like it would be very nice, but the rooms are very good. They layout of having the two beds seperated into two areas within the one room was very nice for my group, having two guys and two girls. It was also nice that there was a t.v. in both areas of the room for both of the beds. The room was very clean and the beds were really comfy. The one thing that I did not like was how small the bathroom was. Also, the bathroom had seen some better days. There was cracking in the ceiling and around the sides of the tub, but not really a big concern. Staff was nice and very helpful when needed. Good hotel for young travellers, especially since the amusement park is right down the road. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very nice and extra friendly”
Reviews.Author: ddd0
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, spacious room. excellent breakfast, extra friendly staff who went out of their way to be helpful. A little far from downtown, but over all a great value for Vancouver. Free parking, free internet, everything was well done.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: eledean
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Best Western twice while visiting my daughter in Vancouver. It was perfect for me because I just needed a good place to sleep. The bed and pillows were very comfortable, and the air conditioner worked well. The front desk people were friendly and helpful. It is located in a safe area, and I walked to my daughter's apartment every day of my visit. The only negative for me was the breakfast, which I didn't think was very good. It is not a fancy hotel nor is the lobby very big, but if you just need a clean, comfortable place to spend the night without spending a lot of money, I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Surprise -- and good deal too!”
Reviews.Author: ORKEMI
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed here the other night (in 3 different rooms). When we got there, it had a small lobby and didn’t look like much. The parking lot was small, but free. So that was a good deal. When we got to the counter (11:00 at night), things changed. We were greeted by Sunny who was the most delightful gentleman. He was ever so gracious and was most accommodating to all of us. I had somehow lost my AAA card (which I had specifically brought with me for this visit). He took my word on being a AAA member. He then upgraded me (for no particular reason) to a King bed, even though I had reserved a Queen. Then, for my friends, he upgraded 2 of them to a suite – again – for no particular reason. I could not believe the welcoming attitude of this gentleman. I can’t remember ever staying somewhere where someone went so much out of their way to accommodate us. This is especially shocking, since it was 11:00 at night, and many times folks are tired at this point in the day. Then, when I got to the room, I was very pleasantly surprised. The hotel is definitely an older facility, but the room was quite large and very clean. The bed was extremely comfortable and the pillows were awesome. The bathroom was nice, had a bowed out shower curtain (allowing more room in the shower). The soap/shampoo/conditioner were all in a machine on the wall – very convenient. The water pressure was good. There was also a coffee maker, iron, microwave, and refrigerator in the room. The room I had looked out to some houses behind us, but above them, I had a very nice view of the mountains. The room was very quiet. I didn’t hear anything at all outside my room that night or the next morning. When we went to breakfast, the continental breakfast was fairly good. It had more than your typical fare – to include waffles. It wasn’t amazing or anything, but it was decent and better than I expected. The suite my friends had was quite nice. The bedrooms were split into two parts. One bed was in an area right near the front of the room. Then came the bathroom in the middle. The other bed was way in the back of the suite. This was nice, because it allowed people sharing a room to kind of have a more private area to sleep. I’d never seen anything quite like this before. There was also a free computer in the lobby to check email, etc. A couple of folks mentioned previously here that this hotel is not in a good area. That is not true at all. It’s definitely not an awesome area or anything, but there were no issues here of being in a bad area. It was just fine. I felt perfectly safe, and to be honest, I didn’t see anyone on the streets that Saturday night. It was more of a residential area, with the Exhibition Park a couple of blocks away. The McDonalds was right across the street. That was pretty convenient. All in all, everyone in my group enjoyed the one night stay at the hotel. I’ve definitely stayed in many nicer hotels before, and absolutely do not want to stay in dive or seedy motels. This hotel was anything but. It was perfectly comfortable, quiet, and clean. It wasn’t the best place I’ve ever stayed, but it was way more than satisfactory. And the price was also terrific. I would ABSOLUTELY stay here again. We were treated very well and enjoyed the comfort of the room (and especially the bed). The only complaint at all I have was that the bath towels were kind of small and thin. Other than that, everything was great. Thanks also to Sunny for his great hospitality. He was also there in the morning upon departure and was just as cordial.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bang for the Buck and Even Better Service”
Reviews.Author: nycbee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights while atttending the Four Continents figure skating competition at the Pacific Coliseum. Location was great and only a ten minute walk to the PC. As an alternative, a bus stops right in front of the hotel on Hastings St. and the ride to PC literally takes a couple of minutes. While the hotel is far from fancy, it hotel offers a great bang for the buck. The breakfast is above average for a hotel of this type and there is a free computer in the lobby. I was very happy with the cleanliness of my room--in fact, I'd call it spotless. What I enjoyed the most was the wonderful staff. They were more than eager to offer assitance, information and services--always with a kind word and a smile. Ali, who I believe is the manager, was a particularly pleasant fellow who truly aimed to please. I would stay here again, in a heartbeat, the next time I'm in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: mojoman22
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated a short distance from the Trans Canada Highway which takes you either to North and West Vancouver and the ferry terminal at Horseshoe Bay to Vancouver Island or east to the Fraser Valley. It is also walking distance from the Pacific National Exhibition grounds as well as the Hastings Park Racetrack. The newly carpeted standard room was clean and quiet but it was the service that I thought was nothing short of superb. Even though I had to change my booking dates when I arrived sooner than I originally planned, they managed to not only make the adjustments that I required but did so at the same price as I had booked on a discount travel website. It is not a four star hotel but more like a hidden gem. I have stayed there twice now and would have no trouble recommending this hotel to friends and family or anyone else for that matter.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, good value!”
Reviews.Author: tripgal2008
Reviews.Content: We booked several rooms for our group that attended a sports tournament in North Vancouver. The rates were reasonable and the service was excellent. The hotel management and staff attended to our needs and were very helpful in recommending places to visit, dinner locations and directions. The hotel has easy access to downtown Vancouver and North Vancouver. When you stay here, visit Giuseppe’s Deli up the street.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst 'hotels' I've ever stay in.”
Reviews.Author: mistersunshine
Reviews.Content: Some of the other reviewers must have much lower standards than I do, because this place was awful. Starting with a small parking lot littered with garbage, rolls of carpet blocking the entrance (they appear to be renovating), a TINY lobby and worn out hall carpeting all inches from a busy street. The room was an average hotel room in size, but there was a small table and two hard chairs and no other furniture--no comfortable place to sit besides the bed. The little table had no power outlet near it so I had to balance my computer on the little refrigerator to charge it in the very unsafe-looking extension cord (not a power strip) stretched behind the TV. They offer HS internet through Tellus for $15 per night and it worked the night I arrived but not in the morning. I rebooted but no internet. I tried to call Tellus customer service but the hotel phone buzzed so loud I couldn't hear. When I called the front desk, they weren't helpful. They offer some sort of continental breakfast, but when I asked about fruit, the desk clerk said "Oh, we offer at least two kinds, apples and oranges or apples and bananas". Only frozen oatmeal and cold cereal. And when I asked for a suggestion for a real breakfast nearby, he couldn't help me. Overall, a disaster of a business "hotel" (motel, really) and a poor value.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: amorkuz
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to make one thing clear regarding previous reviews: there is nothing wrong with the neighborhood of the hotel itself. It is true that between downtown and the hotel there are these several nasty blocks of Hastings Street with all the bums and stuff. But it should also be understood that these nasty blocks are right alongside downtown. That's just how Vancouver is. The moral is: never walk from the hotel to Downtown, take a bus instead. Otherwise, the hotel is fine. Nothing fancy. Just a regular night-in, day-out place.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Shabby Room”
Reviews.Author: kermits
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at the Holiday Inn when attending events at the Coliseum but decided to take advantage of the lower rate at the Best Western. Unfortunately, the condition of the room and lack of a secure place to store our laptop when out of the motel was disappointing. I understood that the rooms had been recently renovated, not. They may had been done 10 years ago, but with lack of up keep, are in poor shape. (The clock radio was disgusting). I had to store my laptop in the truck of my car because the staff didn't have access to the guest safe The staff was wonderful, the manager exceptional, he even offered my husband a tray to bring me breakfast in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: cbsr18
Reviews.Content: We were going to Vancouver for the Memorial Cup, which was held at the Pacific Coliseum. This hotel was a 15 minute walk from the rink, which was perfect because parking was $10. We stayed here from May18-27. The rooms had been newly renovated and were cleaned daily. The front desk staff were very friendly, giving us tips on where to eat (as well as coupons) and ideas on sight seeing. There is a continental breakfast every morning which was good. There was a mini fridge in our room which was very convenient, as well as numerous restaurants and pubs within walking distance from the hotel. Attractions such as the Capilano Suspension Bridge, Stanley Park, Science World were a 20 minute drive tops. I would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Eh? Okay.”
Reviews.Author: cassilicious
Reviews.Content: We'd never been to Vancouver before, and therefore had no idea that this hotel was so close to the worst parts of town. Me and my husband didn't feel safe walking down the street at night, by any means. And about 10 blocks down the street, towards downtown, is the absolute worst part of Vancouver. Actually, when we were in the cab to the hotel on the way from the airport, the cab driver actually winced when we told him where we were staying. Almost all of the cabs we took went 5--10 blocks out of the way to avoid driving through the parts of town closest to the hotel. When it came to the actual hotel, it had a very, very strange smell. Almost like the strongest moth balls you'll ever experience. Thankfully it was only in the hallways and disappeared once you got into the room. The hallway ceilings had gaping holes in them and water stains. Fortunately, the rooms were much nicer than the hallway or lobby suggested. Comfy bed (we got the king), with a fridge, which was helpful since we stayed 5 nights. Wireless internet costs a pretty penny, though. The rooms were quiet, housekeeping was good, the shower was nice. The continental breakfast was nice, and saved us some money. Most days, we took some extra fruit and muffins for snacks on our excursions. The people at the front desk were SUPER nice. When we checked in, the man pulled out a map and showed us all his favorite places to go, and explained all the public transit information. Truthfully, if like us, all of the things you want to do is in the Downtown Area, I'd recommend spending a little more money and getting closer to Downtown. You'll feel safer, and spend less money on cabs.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, good service”
Reviews.Author: CDN_Member
Reviews.Content: We paid an average of CAD$103/night, which was very reasonable for the Vancouver area. Based on the price, we weren't expecting a lot but were very pleasantly surprised. We had a room with a king size bed and the room was huge. It was in excellent condition with a nice big bathroom, which was very clean and modern. We had all the amenities we needed (phone, TV, A/C, wireless internet, etc). Included in the price was a continental breakfast, which saved us a few extra dollars. The front desk staff were very pleasant and helpful. One recommendation for the management would be to turn on the A/C in the lobby/breakfast room. It was VERY warm when we were there and our initial impression wasn't great, which was a shame because everything else was excellent. The location was a little far out (about 20-30 min from downtown), but anything closer was getting VERY expensive. We would definitely recommend this hotel if you don't need to be right downtown. Parking was also free, which was a pleasant change from anywhere else in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!!”
Reviews.Author: tweez99
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 3 girlfriends for a "girl's weekend away" and really enjoyed my time. The room's were spacious with two bed's seperated by a wall, with their own dressers and televisions. It was almost like having two rooms. There was a small fridge and continental breakfast. The service of the front desk was wonderful!!! Every time we had a question they were more than helpful, often time's going out of their way to make sure "the girls" were taken care of. It's not a four star hotel but it is clean and comfortable and family run and great for the price!!
